If I can give a zero star rating, I would.  I don't know who posted the other reviews but I need to re-calibrate this yelp rating.I yelped this restaurant and decided to give it a go... I should've known better when there was only a couple of reviews.Here's my experience.  This place is down one of the main streets off of La Rambla.  When I walked in there were only 2 customers sitting a the bar.  No one else.What I ordered:1 Glass of the house red wine1 order of PaellaRed wine was nothing special.The Paella sucked.  I'll upload the picture later but about a quarter way through I asked the waiter if this was a typical paella.  He said it was typical from the Valencia region of Spain.  Regardless of where it's from, the rice in paella should be cooked.  It was very undercooked and only 5 pieces of seafood in the dish.  A couple of small shrimp and a couple of mussels.  1 of the mussel was not even cooked.I left still hungry and didn't finish the dish. I left it about 3/4 full. As I left the restaurant, the staff did not even acknowledge me.  No Thank you, no goodbye.If you're a tourist, AVOID this place!!
